Posts.Content: Apr 23, 2012 09:04PM borntosurvive wrote: Waiting is definitely the worst part.  Hang in there as best you can, cry and scream when you need to and laugh when you can.  Sending positive thoughts, white light and gentle hugs xo
Posts.Title: Still in shock Shachar grace56

Posts.Content: Apr 10, 2012 09:17PM borntosurvive wrote: I just finished my DD ACT on April 5th.  I still have my eyebrows although they thinned a bit.  I have about 6 eyelashes on my right eye and 12 on the left.  My bottom lashes are pretty well gone.  Sometimes when I blink my eyelids stick together.  My hair is prickly and my head actually hurts a bit - feels like a tight pony tail.  Did anyone experience this when their hair started to grow back?  Anything that helped it out?
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: May 3, 2012 03:21PM borntosurvive wrote: What does the coconut oil help with? I have also seen people using olive oil?

Posts.Content: May 4, 2012 07:49PM borntosurvive wrote: I have been ditching my wig and just wearing a ball cap.  I feel "half topless".  I am only a month out of chemo and have a head full of white fuzz.  At least it's growing and not falling out anymore.
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: May 20, 2012 08:53AM borntosurvive wrote: GREAT looking hair Mizmarie.  I only have a five o'clock shadow right now.  I got the Anastasia eyebrow stencil kit from Sephora.  It is AMAZING.  I really like it and you can pick whatever shape eyebrow you want.  It comes for in two colours - light and dark.  Works really well.  My eyebrows are barely coming back in so I feel better just having the kit on hand for when I need to have my eyebrows on.
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: May 4, 2012 09:10PM borntosurvive wrote:
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: May 7, 2012 08:15AM borntosurvive wrote: I went topless yesterday in the pool when I went to family swim yesterday with my kids and husband.  I am still bald as I'm only a month PFC.  I walked on the deck, head held high and didn't care if people looked at me or not.  I did catch the lifeguard looking at my like I was a pound puppy and my husband said, "She's a lifeguard, shouldn't she be looking at everyone and not just you".  I told him I didn't care.  I am healthy and finally swimmiing with my family (after a friend had filled in for me during my chemo).  I do miss my hair but I have also come to accept that I don't need my hair to live and I know it will grow back.  Don't get me wrong, I am impatient but in the moment of swiming with my family my lack of hair really didn't matter.
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Jun 10, 2012 09:42PM borntosurvive wrote: I have been away for a bit with a 5 day girls trip to Florida last week.  Just getting caught up.  While I was in Florida my eyebrows became CRAZY so I went and had them waxed.  I actually have full eyebrows now.  I am also enough eyebrows to wear mascara now.  My hair is coming in SO thick and soft.  I have about a centimetre of hair all over my head.  I'm 2 mons PFC.  It's all coming back quickly.  I think the heat, sunshine and wind does help.  It seems that hair grows faster in the summer months - maybe that's because I am more aware of how often I have to shave my legs!! My DH told me yesterday that I should get back to the gym.  Why don't you just say that I've gained a little weight?! I don't think he has any filter.  He has been trying to dig out of that hole since he said it.
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Jun 18, 2012 09:47AM borntosurvive wrote: I have a "brush cut" type style (2 mos PFC) and I woke up this morning with bed head!!!  To funny.

Posts.Content: May 25, 2012 07:45PM borntosurvive wrote: I actually USED shampoo this morning in the shower.  I have a 5 o'clock shadow all over my head.  My hair is coming in dark.  It's as soft as a gund teddy bear.  I also have the 5 o'clock eyebrow shadow and my eyelashes are coming in.  HURRAY!!!!!  Another few weeks and I might even have bed head.

Posts.Content: May 9, 2012 04:23PM borntosurvive wrote: I had my hair cut to save my pony tail before chemo started.  Then I had my hairdresser cut my hair into a very short pixie cut just after my first round of chemo.  My hair started falling out after my second round (I had dose dense AC/T) and my husband shaved my head with his clippers to a "zero".  I just let it fall out from there.  I kept my eyebrows and most of my lashes during chemo but my lashes started to fall out during Taxol.  I am just a month PFC and NOW my eyebrows are falling out.  My lashes are gone completely but that did not happen until 14 days PFC.  I can see new lashes started to come in.  My head is covered in white fuzz.  So things are happening in the growth department :)

Posts.Content: Apr 26, 2012 09:09PM borntosurvive wrote: I finished chemo April 5th and so I'm in the white peach fuzz stage.  It's itchy and my head feels tight but my husband says he can actually see the fuzz in the light.  So I guess the hair growth has begun!
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Apr 29, 2012 11:02PM borntosurvive wrote: I have had some blurred vision off and on since having chemo.  I was told this is normal and could be catracts.  I just seem to have trouble focusing every so often.  Like my contacts are fuzzy or something.  Between that and my chemo brain I feel like I'm in a constant fog!
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: May 17, 2012 03:24PM borntosurvive wrote: I am 5.5 weeks PFC and my fuzz is now turning dark.  My friend came over today and could not believe how much my fuzz has grown in the last week.  My eyelashes are coming in.  I lost my last eyebrow the other day (they didn't start falling out until AFTER chemo) and I have tiny eyebrows peeking through.  I had to shave my legs last week.  I was never so excited to shave my legs before!!!!!  Things are happening in the hair department.  I can't wait to have a cute pixie cut.  I found some natural oil at home that I used on my son as a baby and it works well on my head.  I find my head SO itchy as my hair is coming in.  It's fine until I have a chemopause hot flash and oil starts to run down my face!
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Jun 18, 2012 09:39PM borntosurvive wrote: You are stunning AEM.  I finished April 5th and have about the same as you.  Congrats on going topless and welcome to the world.  It feels like freedom!!

Posts.Content: Jun 20, 2012 08:46PM borntosurvive wrote: Thanks ladies.  I modeled when I was younger and paid my way through University.  I stopped when I was finished high school.  It was a previous life as I like to say.  I had these pictures done because I wanted to capture my bald head.  I owe A LOT of credit to my photographer and the editing that she did.  She's amazing.  When I called her to ask for the photoshoot I never imagined that they would turn out like that.  Thanks for all the comments.
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Aug 16, 2012 10:40PM borntosurvive wrote: I had neulasta and had minimal bone pain in my jaw, neck and chest for 2 days after - I made sure to take Tylenol and Claritan an hour before the shot and for 3 days after (once a day) and that helped.  Warm baths and heating pad.  It was okay.  I have a 2 year old and 4 year old at home and did chemo over the winter so the germs the boys brought home from daycare plus the germy winter, I never got sick.  My counts were always good and I never had to be in the hospital for a fever or anything.  So the bone pain was a trade off and worth it in the end.  Good luck to you.
